BMI indicates that the individual is underweight, potentially leading to health risks. Adequate nutrition and a balanced lifestyle are recommended for improvement.
BMI falls within the healthy range, indicating a balanced weight for the individual\'s height. This is associated with a lower risk of various health problems.
BMI classifies the individual as overweight, suggesting an excess of body weight that may impact health. Lifestyle modifications, including diet and exercise, are advised.
BMI categorizes the individual as obese, indicating a significant excess of body weight. Lifestyle changes and medical supervision may be necessary to address associated health risks.

BMI places the individual in the category of severe obesity, signifying a critical level of excess body weight. Urgent lifestyle changes, medical intervention, and professional guidance are essential for health improvement.
